intro: Rhamnus guayaquilensis, commonly known as the Guayaquil buckthorn, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in axillary inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, smooth, black drupe that contains a single seed. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
